headline.main: The Husband of a Smoker Testifies On Her Death From Lung Cancer

byline.original: By DONALD JANSON, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: His voice breaking with emotion, Antonio Cipollone told a jury in Federal court today how his wife died in his arms in 1984 after an excruciating bout with cancer that followed 40 years of heavy cigarette smoking.
docs.snippet: LEAD: His voice breaking with emotion, Antonio Cipollone told a jury in Federal court today how his wife died in his arms in 1984 after an excruciating bout with cancer that followed 40 years of heavy cigarette smoking.

headline.main: Where You Can Light Up Under New York's New Law

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: New York City's new anti-smoking law will restrict smoking in most enclosed public spaces, from restaurants to hotel lobbies to offices. Here are the basic provisions of the law: Places of Employment
docs.snippet: LEAD: New York City's new anti-smoking law will restrict smoking in most enclosed public spaces, from restaurants to hotel lobbies to offices. Here are the basic provisions of the law:  Places of Employment
